organic_results.title: Ethnic differences in school behavior
organic_results.snippet: Information from Hispanic parents, students, and teachers concerning the behavioral differences between Anglo and Hispanic children was used to generate a behavioral rating scale. Two hundred and sixty-two children from four ethnic groups (Latino, Mexican, US born Spanish surnamed, and Anglo) were rated by thirty-nine Spanish-bilingual teachers using this rating scale. Though substantial differences among the ethnic groups' behavioral ratings were noted, socioeconomic variables may have been more pervasive than ethnicity in …
